*div1 type="summary"* *p*Elias R. Wightman to Austin, August 23, 1826. Application for town site.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Petition */person_mentioned*of the undersigned respectfully REPRESENT, that haveing removed to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, with an intention of settling in it permanently as one of the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*which you are authorized to introduce, as *person_mentioned*Empresario*/person_mentioned*, He has examined a piece of *location_mentioned*land on the east Side of the Rio Colorado*/location_mentioned*, being *location_mentioned*near its mouth and being the extremity of the high Prairie*/location_mentioned*; and the most suitable place for the landing of *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, who emigrate, by water, to that part of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*At this time there are no *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*of any kind, *location_mentioned*at, or near, the said landing-place*/location_mentioned*, which render it both dangerous, and inconvenient for *person_mentioned*Emigrants */person_mentioned*to disembark there; dangerous, in consequence of exposure to the *person_mentioned*Karonkawa Indians*/person_mentioned*, who are hostile, and infest that part of the *location_mentioned*Bay-Shore*/location_mentioned*, Inconvenient oweing to the want of *location_mentioned*Houses*/location_mentioned*, to receive *person_mentioned*Emigrants*/person_mentioned*, and store up their property, on this first landing. In consequence of which many are detered from emigrating to that part of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—A number of my *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, and acquaintances and particularly *person_mentioned*H. H. League*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*James C. Ludlow*/person_mentioned* who have explored the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and entered into arrangements, with you as *person_mentioned*Empresario */person_mentioned*for their reception as *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*together with a number of other *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, whom they expect to bring have a desire to land at the above mentioned place provided suitable *location_mentioned*buyldings*/location_mentioned*, can be provided for the security of their *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*, and, products and they have requested me to erect, such necessary *location_mentioned*buyldings */location_mentioned*provided it meets with the approbation of the constituted local authority of the *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Therefore your *person_mentioned*Petitioner */person_mentioned*prays permission to occupy said place for the above purposes and that a *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*of one League of land may be made to him at said place, to erect such *location_mentioned*buyldings */location_mentioned*as he may put up, in consideration of the great Service he will render the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*, and the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*by facilitating emigration, and in order to inable him to support his *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*on said land—*/p*
*p*(Signed) *person_mentioned* Elias R. Wightman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*considering the exposed situation of *person_mentioned*Emigrants */person_mentioned*to this *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* who land *location_mentioned*at the mouth of the Colorado River*/location_mentioned*, in consequence of causes set forth in the foregoing Petition; And haveing fully considered of the necessity of such an establishment, as the one proposed, and the general utility that would result to the *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*therefrom, Therefore I *person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin Empresario*/person_mentioned*, and *person_mentioned*Judge of this Jurisdiction*/person_mentioned* do hereby grant the *person_mentioned*Petition */person_mentioned*presented by the said *person_mentioned*Elias Wightman*/person_mentioned*, to occupy said place and to buyld the necessary *location_mentioned*houses */location_mentioned*for the accommodation and Security of *person_mentioned*Settlers */person_mentioned*referring him to the Government of the *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned*, or the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*appointed by the Government for this *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*to apply for a title to the land which he solicits with the understanding that this permission is to be subject to the approval of the said *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*, or *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*as they may deem proper, and Knowing the great expense and hasard attending the Execution of such Improvements and *location_mentioned*buyldings */location_mentioned*as are contemplated in consequence of the hostility of the *person_mentioned*Indians*/person_mentioned*, and the remoteness of the *location_mentioned*Settlements */location_mentioned*I do recommend the *person_mentioned*Petition */person_mentioned*of the said *person_mentioned*Elias Wightmen */person_mentioned*for the grant of a League of Land, to the particular attention of Government, or *person_mentioned*Commissioners*/person_mentioned*, and should it be consistent with the laws to make such *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*I recommend that it be made as prayed for—*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Sn Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="08-23-1826">August 23d 1826*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
